meanings.definition: To cancel (a postage stamp) before use.
meanings.sent1: I precancelled the stamp before sending the letter.
meanings.sent2: The post office precancelled the stamps to prevent reuse.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf precancelled all the stamps in the house as a prank.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement precancelled any worries she had about the postage.
meanings.sent5: The teacher precancelled the stamps with a smile, making them unique.

meanings.definition: A postage stamp that has been cancelled before use.
meanings.sent1: I used a precancelled stamp on the envelope.
meanings.sent2: The collector added a rare precancelled stamp to their collection.
meanings.sent3: The precancelled stamp had a tiny picture of a cat on it.
meanings.sent4: The precancelled stamp was like a little piece of art on the envelope.
meanings.sent5: The precancelled stamp stood out with its bright colors.
